cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) as it deals with the segmentation of hashtags, which are textual utterances used on social media platforms. Additionally, the paper proposes novel neural approaches for hashtag segmentation, which is a common technique used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks. 

The paper also involves ranking candidate segmentations, which is a common technique used in information retrieval (IR) tasks. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR). 

The proposed approaches in the paper involve the use of neural networks, which is a common technique used in machine learning (ML) tasks. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). 

Finally, the paper involves the use of sentiment analysis, which is a common NLP task. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE), which deals with the application of neural networks and evolutionary algorithms in various tasks, including NLP.
